atod.models package¶

There are actual classes which are used for data access.

interfaces.py – provides abstraction on how class representing single
substance or group should look like. I planned to make not only abilities and heroes, but much more, so this would define common way to work with all the classes.

everything else – just models.

Submodules¶

atod.models.abilities module¶

class atod.models.abilities.Abilities(i_members=[])¶

Bases: atod.models.interfaces.Group

Any amount of abilities as one substance.

classmethod all()¶

Creates Abilities object with all heroes’ abilities in the game.

classmethod from_hero_id(hero_id, patch='')¶

Adds to members all abilities of the hero with hero_id.

get_description()¶

Returns sum of abilities labels.

Function takes all the descriptions of abilities (by labels) and sums them up field by field.

Results:
pd.Series: where value in every labels is sum between all the
abilities in object.
member_type¶

alias of Ability

atod.models.ability module¶

class atod.models.ability.Ability(id_, lvl=0, patch='')¶

Bases: atod.models.interfaces.Member

Representation of Ability data.

Attributes:
name (str): name of ability lvl (int) : level of ability
get_description(include: list)¶

Combines specs and labels in one description.

Possible values in include list:
  • labels
  • specs
  • texts
  • name
  • id
Args:
include: list of fields which should be included in description.
Returns:
pd.DataFrame: description with requested fields.

class atod.models.hero.Hero(id_, lvl=1, patch='')¶

Bases: atod.models.interfaces.Member

Representation of single Hero.

Attributes:
name (str) : name of the hero in_game_name (str) : name that is used for hero inside the game lvl (int) : current hero lvl specs (dict) : raw db row as dictionary abilities (Abilities): representation of hero’s abilities

classmethod from_name(name, lvl=1, patch='')¶

Converts name to id with and calls init.

Args:
name (str) : hero’s is game name in the game lvl (int) : desired level of the hero patch (str): same as version of the game
Raises:
ValueError: if name is not in heroes.name column TypeError : if name is not str Also can raise same as __init__().
get_description(include: list)¶

Constructs hero description.

Possible include values: * ‘name’ * ‘id’ * ‘laning’ * ‘role’ * ‘type’ * ‘attributes’

Args:
include (list, default=[]): tells how the hero should be described.

atod.models.heroes module¶

class atod.models.heroes.Heroes(i_members=[])¶

Bases: atod.models.interfaces.Group

classmethod all(patch='')¶

Creates Heroes object with all heroes in the game.

classmethod from_ids(ids: list, patch='')¶

Creates Heroes object from list of ids.

classmethod from_names(names: list, patch='')¶

Creates Heroes object from list of names.

get_description(include)¶

Sums up heroes descriptions in `include`d categories.

Notes:
‘name’ and ‘id’ will be dropped because where is no reason to add together string and hero id.
Returns:
pd.Series: sum of desired attributes for all members (heroes).
get_ids(binarised=False)¶

Returns heroes ids.

Can be useful, when you have a team and instead of getting id for all heroes you use this.

Args:
binarised (bool, default=False): if bin the function will return
binarised vector of heroes ids, so you don’t need to know how many heroes are in the game.
Returns:
pd.Series: shape=(, len(self.members)) by default, if binary version
was requested shape=(, # heroes in the game).
get_names()¶
Returns:
list: names of members.

class atod.models.interfaces.Group(i_members=[])¶

Represents abstract set of members.

Creates object with all possible members.

alias of Member

class atod.models.interfaces.Member(id_, lvl, patch)¶

Bases: object

The parent class for all the single elements.

Attributes:
model (sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.DeclarativeMeta):
SQlAlchemy based model which represents table in the db.

id (int) : unique identifier among other members. lvl (int) : level of a member patch (str): patch for which data should be provided

get_description()¶

Returns description of an object as a pd.Series.

model = None¶

atod.models.match module¶

Class to get match description.

class atod.models.match.Match(match_id: int)¶

Bases: object

Representation of the single match.

Attributes:
id (int) : id of the match radiant (Heroes): Heroes in radiant team dire (Heroes): Heroes in dire team
get_description(include)¶

Returns description of certain match.

Description consist of 3 parts: radiant description, dire description and result. Complete length of description vector is 2n + 1, where n is a length of side description (depends on choosen parameters).

Args:
include (list): the same with Hero.get_description().
Returns:
pd.Series
